Input.Review:
Rochelle Vassell
6 April, 2022
Wow, I can't believe the lack of integrity such a big company as Hubspot CRM has. the first year was good, they were attentive, but that was only because they wanted me to spend more. The following years were no support and if I asked they would say well I don't have phone support options (which in fact I did). That to me is even crazy, any customer should have basic customer support. After my 2nd year I started shopping around because really their system looks and feels tired, its old, doesn't integrate well, phone calls always drop, email/mail function is tacky and not inspiring, the automation is basic and the ads don't pull the right analytics. And the landing pages and forms are plain and basic. I mostly just used the CRM. Anyhow, I canceled my auto renewal and purchased another software and can you believe they charged my card and locked me into another year?! What? I even sent proof and they said they'll have to wait and see. LISTEN RUN! DON"T DO IT! It's better to build your own or mash a few tools together.

snippet.title: igloohome SMART Digital Door Lock Push Pull Mortise REVIEW + Airbnb integration

Input.Review: Dan F. Gong has changed the way I manage my pipeline. What do you like best about Gong?The intel and visibility that Going provides into my pipeline (our instance is integrated with SFDC). The ability to see activity, the number and seniority of contacts engaged, and Gong's underlying AI that helps us predict where we'll land is a game changer. We also use the Smart Trackers to measure specific Challenger behaviors that helps us study how effective we are at selling, and to identify areas to coach.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.What do you dislike about Gong?The UI/UX perioudically changes unexpectedly.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.What problems is Gong solving and how is that benefiting you?Reps are notorius for not keeping good CRM notes. Gong cuts that out. We see exactly what is happening in the deal, by virtue of it happening.

Output.Business as Usual: Sales pipeline on Salesforce SFDC. Struggling with lack of visibility due to inconsistent CRM usage by sales representatives, using traditional methods for sales performance analysis
Output.New Behaviour: Using Gong to manage sales pipeline and gain insights into deals.
Output.Progress the Customer Wants to Make: Improve sales performance, gain better visibility into deals, and forecasting accuracy to make data-driven decisions.
Output.Functional Motivation: Access to comprehensive sales data and analytics, improved visibility into deal progress, and ability to track key sales behaviors.
Output.Emotional Motivation: Reduce frustration and uncertainty associated with inaccurate sales data and lack of pipeline visibility. Gain confidence in sales forecasting and decision-making.
Output.Social Motivation: Not enough information
Output.Force 1: Push: Challenges with maintaining inaccurate or incomplete CRM data due to reps not keeping notes updated, lack of visibility into deal progress and health, difficulty in identifying areas for improvement in sales process.
Output.Force 2: Pull: Gong's ability to provide real-time insights into sales pipeline activity.
Output.Force 3: Anxieties: Potential difficulty in adapting to a new tool, concerns about UI/UX changes.
Output.Force 4: Habits: Using Salesforce CRM (SFDC) and relying on manual data entry.
Output.Stage 3: Active Looking: Not enough information
Output.Stage 4: Deciding: Not Enough Information.
Output.Stage 5: Onboarding: Not enough information, but the review implies successful integration with Salesforce (SFDC) and utilization of features like Smart Trackers.
Output.Stage 6: Ongoing Use: The review indicates ongoing use and satisfaction with Gong, highlighting the positive impact on pipeline management and sales effectiveness. The user acknowledges occasional UI/UX changes but considers the benefits outweigh the drawbacks.

Input.Review:
Most Singaporeans imagine they'll be in their 40's - at least - before upgrading to a condo; and realistically speaking, this is the norm in Singapore's private property market. Most of us are reliant on the proceeds from our first flat, to fuel a condo purchase. However, there are always exceptions to the rule.

In this week's article, we spoke to a young Singaporean named Khai, who bought a condo unit at the age of 25. And before you think it, he's not a hotshot investment banker earning six digits a year. Here's how he managed it:

An early interest in property

Khai had always aspired to have his own home. He explains that he grew up in a four-room flat in Bukit Panjang, and there were eight of us in the family. So since young, I had been aiming at having my own place; preferably before the age of 30.

Khai's passion for property was also influenced by his parents, who brought me to private and HDB showflats almost every weekend since I was six years old. I loved to admire HDB flats and condos.

Khai has seen so many properties, he can make an accurate guess of the layout just from the fa√ßade of a residential block; right down to the estimated square footage and age of the building.

The journey to early private home ownership

Khai works as a civil servant, currently earning about $5,000 a month. For most Singaporeans, this would make it a challenge to own a private property before 30. However, Khai was certain about starting out with a private home right away.

Khai was also informed: I had been reading about property data and news since I was 13 years old, mainly through newspaper articles.

Having to wait till 35* to own an HDB flat is a long time, he says, so I started working at 17, right after O-levels. I worked part-time in retail, and I had to juggle between two retail part-time jobs, and three years of study for my Diploma.

During his National Service, Khai saved up as much of his allowance as he could. Over the course of seven years of disciplined savings, he thought he had saved up enough for the down payment on a private home.

*Applying for an HDB flat as a single requires you to be at least 35 years old

Saving up for the first home

Khai explains his savings plan as follows:

Between 2010 to 2014 (after O-levels and throughout Polytechnic) - Approx. $800 to $1,000 per month
Between 2014 to 2016 (National Service) - Approx. $500 to $800 per month
Between 2016 to 2018 (Full Time Work) - Approx. $2,000 to $2,500 per month 

Year	Monthly Savings	Yearly Savings
2010	$800 - $1,000	~$10,800
2011	$800 - $1,000	~$10,800
2012	$800 - $1,000	~$10,800
2013	$800 - $1,000	~$10,800
2014	$800 - $1,000	~$10,800
2015	$500 - $800	~$7,800
2016	$500 - $800	~$7,800
2017	$2,000 - $2,500	~$27,000
2018	$2,000 - $2,500	~$27,000
Total	~$123,600
Overall, Khai's savings plan averages out at just above $1,400 a month over the years. He kept expenses low, at just around $500 per month.

However, Khai had to tweak his plans slightly, despite accumulating enough for the down payment.

Cooling measures required a change of plans

In July 2018, the government passed new cooling measures. With most of the media attention focused on the increased Additional Buyers Stamp Duty (ABSD), it was easy to lose sight of an equally important change - one that would affect first-time home buyers like Khai, even though he wasn't subject to the ABSD.

This was the decrease in the maximum Loan To Value (LTV) ratio, which determines how much you can borrow for your property. 

Prior to July 2018, the LTV ratio was capped at 80 per cent - that is, the maximum loan quantum was 80 per cent of the property price or value, whichever is lower. After the cooling measures, the LTV was reduced to 75 per cent; and the five per cent difference was significant:

Initially I wanted a new launch Khai says, and I last balloted for Twin VEW; but with the down payment increased to 25 per cent, I was priced out.

Twin VEW is a 99-year leasehold property in Clementi; notice that the cooling measures hit close to its early sales. Prices averaged $1,405 psf at the time, with many of the single bedders at around $680,000. As such, an added five per cent down payment would have meant about $34,000 more.

In the end, Khai decided to opt for a resale condo instead. He also noted that other advantages included a lower quantum, and being able to move in immediately.

As such, he settled on Parc Rosewood - a 99-year leasehold condo in Woodlands, which was completed in 2014. Khai was able to secure a single-bedder, at a reasonable price point:

Purchase price	$518,000
Down payment	$129,500 total: $91,500 (cash) + $38,000 (CPF)
Total home loan	$388,500, at 2.1% per annum (30-year loan tenure)
Monthly repayment	Approx. $1,455 per month, est. total interest of $135,472 by end of 30 years
Buyers Stamp Duty (BSD)	$10,140*
Conveyancing fee*	$2,500*
The lower cash outlay, along with the ability to move in immediately, now sees him living in a private property well before his 30's. Quite the accomplishment, given that many of us haven't even upgraded from our flats by 35! 

*Khai paid the BSD and conveyancing fee in cash. However, note that BSD can also be paid from CPF, and some lawyer fees can be paid from CPF (it depends on the firm you use).

Most importantly, the property proves right for the owner

I'm super happy with it, Khai says, It's a corner unit with an extra window at the dining area, so I can enjoy the greenery. Plus there's a toilet window for better ventilation!

Above all, there's a sense of joy in having his private space, which makes the years of hard work and forced savings pay off.

Depending on the future state of the property market, Khai may also have the means to upgrade; perhaps to a one-bedder plus study, or to another location. 

The one thing Khai may have done differently, however, is not to have taken up the two-year fixed rate.

It kind of sucks to be locked in during this low interest rate, Khai says, referring to the current rate of 1.3 per cent (this recent plunge in interest rates was due to the Covid-19 downturn). 

However my two-year lock-in is almost up, and I can look at repricing or refinancing soon.

To be fair, interest rates seemed to be rising at the time Khai bought the property; and no one could have foreseen the Covid-19 situation. However, home owners should take note that a fixed-rate period is also a lock-in period (e.g. if you were to take a five-year fixed rate, you would also be locked-in for those To be fair, interest rates seemed to be rising at the time Khai bought the property; and no one could have foreseen the Covid-19 situation. However, home owners should take note that a fixed-rate period is also a lock-in period (e.g. if you were to take a five-year fixed rate, you would also be locked-in for those five years).

Khai shows it's possible to own a private property even at a young age (and without being born with a silver spoon)

The main challenge, as Khai correctly identified, is the initial down payment on the home. 

In fact, many Singaporeans don't have trouble passing other requirements, such as the Total Debt Servicing Ratio (TDSR)*, or paying for stamp duties (which can also be covered by CPF). The main challenge is meeting the 25 per cent down payment, which requires a period of dedicated savings. 

Note that, as Khai did above, you don't have to make the whole down payment in cash. Only the first five per cent must be paid in cash; but the next 20 per cent can be paid in any combination of cash or CPF.

Feel free to contact us on Facebook, if you need to know whether you have sufficient savings for any given property.

Another consideration is flexibility. Khai was willing to change his plans and go for a resale unit instead. Young homeowners would do well not to fixate too much on a given property (e.g. insisting it must be new), and get what is within affordability.

(You can always sell and upgrade a few more years down the road, when your property has appreciated and your savings have grown). 

*The TDSR restricts your total monthly home loan repayment, plus other debt obligations, to no more than 60 per cent of your monthly income.

Input.Review: My name is Stuart and I'm a retired engineer. My wife Anne and I purchased a condo with Seashine Abodes last year.¬†For years, Anne and I lived in our spacious family home, filled with memories and laughter. But as our children grew up and moved out, the house began to feel like a burden. The upkeep was demanding, the stairs became a challenge, and the echoing emptiness felt... well, lonely.             It was during the holidays, as we were setting up the decorations and preparing for a large Thanksgiving gathering with the kids, that the thought first hit us: we were done hosting the holidays. It was just too much work. It was time to downsize. The idea simmered for months, occasionally coming to the forefront when a chore became too much, or yet another water leak sprung in one of the unused rooms.                         Then, a dear friend passed away, leaving his wife to manage and move out of their large house alone. It was a wake-up call. We didn't want to be in that situation ourselves. We wanted to enjoy our retirement years, travel, and spend time with our grandkids without the constant worry of a big house.                         That's when we started actively looking for a smaller place. We visited several communities, and one of them was the condos by Seashine Abodes.¬†The moment we walked into the model unit, we were impressed. It was modern, well-designed, and had everything we needed on one floor - no more stairs! We particularly loved the open kitchen and living area, perfect for entertaining small groups but not big enough to host any large gatherings.                         But our excitement was coupled with anxiety. How would we ever sort through a lifetime of belongings? The thought of packing and moving was daunting, to say the least. We also worried about leaving our community and friends.                         Seashine Abodes seemed to understand our concerns. They offered a storage facility across the street, complete with a sorting room where we could go through our things at our own pace. Even better, they included movers who packed and transported everything for us! This took a huge weight off our shoulders and made the transition so much smoother.                         Another pleasant surprise was the small additional room they offered to store our dining room table. We hadn't realized how emotionally attached we were to that table, a silent witness to countless family dinners and celebrations. Knowing it had a place in our new home made all the difference.   Moving into our condo was the start of a new chapter for Anne and me. We love the ease and convenience of condo living.¬†Our neighbours have been friendly, with plenty of fellow retirees. We've joined the community's pickleball teams and Anne loves the local mahjong club.¬†We have more time for our hobbies, travel, and most importantly, each other. Thank you, Seashine Abodes, for understanding what downsizing truly means and for helping us make this transition with ease and peace of mind. We're happy to be home.

Output.Business as Usual: Living in a large family home that was becoming increasingly difficult to manage and maintain as they aged and their children moved out.
Output.New Behaviour: Moved into a modern, well-designed condo with Seashine Abodes
Output.Progress the Customer Wants to Make: Downsize to a smaller, more manageable home that allows them to enjoy their retirement years without the burdens of a large house.
Output.Functional Motivation: Reduce the physical demands and time commitment associated with maintaining a large property. Gain convenience and accessibility with single-floor living and amenities. Easy to make the move due to Seashine Abodes providing moving and storage services.
Output.Emotional Motivation: Escape stress and burden associated with maintaining the large, empty family home. Create a comfortable and enjoyable living environment that promotes relaxation and enjoyment in retirement.
Output.Social Motivation: Maintain their social connections and community while transitioning to a smaller living space. Spend more quality time with family and friends without the constraints of home maintenance. Connect with fellow retirees in social activities like pickleball and mahjong¬†in condo community.
Output.Force 1: Push: The increasing difficulty of managing and maintaining a large home, feelings of loneliness and burden, and the desire for a more relaxed and enjoyable retirement lifestyle.
Output.Force 2: Pull: Attractiveness of a modern, well-designed condo with single-floor living, amenities, and a sense of community. The convenience and support offered by Seashine Abodes, including storage facilities, moving assistance, and understanding of downsizing needs.
Output.Force 3: Anxieties: Concerns about sorting belongings, the daunting task of packing and moving, and adjusting to a new community and living environment.
Output.Force 4: Habits: Emotional attachment to their family home and the memories associated with it, established routines and familiarity with their previous neighborhood.
Output.Stage 1: First Thought: The idea of downsizing emerged during a holiday gathering when they realized the burden of hosting and maintaining a large house.
Output.Stage 2: Passive Looking: The idea of downsizing lingered for months, triggered by challenges with home maintenance and the changing needs of their lifestyle.
Output.Stage 3: Active Looking: After a friend's passing highlighted the potential future difficulties of managing a large house, they began actively exploring options that met their needs like smaller homes and communities  like Seashine Abodes.
Output.Stage 4: Deciding: Chose Seashine Abodes based on the design, amenities, and support services offered. Made trade-offs, accepting the need to downsize their belongings and leave their family home to achieve a more manageable and enjoyable lifestyle.
Output.Stage 5: Onboarding: Experienced a smooth transition with the assistance of Seashine Abodes, including storage facilities and moving services. Appreciated the understanding and support provided during the downsizing process.
Output.Stage 6: Ongoing Use: Enjoy the ease, convenience, and freedom of their new condo lifestyle. Have more time for hobbies, travel, and social activities, building new connections within the condominium community.

Input.Target Product: The Last Of Us video game
Input.Review Transcript: I usually start my video reviews out with an anecdote or a story but with the last of us I'm going to cut right through the chase Naughty Dog the sony own studio responsible for the likes of Crash Bandicoot and Uncharted has hit yet another home run this time with a game that tells the dark hopeless story of a man and a young girl crossing the post-apocalyptic United States but this home run didn't just hobble over the outfield wall it cleared the bleachers that left the park and soared into the parking lot and landed with a loud clunk00:36on someone's windshield the Last of Us is that good that's significantly better than a vast majority of the games on the market cementing itself not only as perhaps PlayStation 3 single best experience but is further proof that naughty dog is the best developer in gaming you are smarter than this really guess what we're shady people Joel it's been that way for a long time we are survivable she's our champ it is over test the Last of Us is a marvel of presentation a game that puts you directly into a disheveled and01:10destroyed United States and never lets you forget that you're surrounded by pain by misery and loss you take control of main character Joel two decades after a vicious fungus cordyceps obliterates humankind naturally it's a decidedly sad situation juxtaposed against often brilliant backdrops of untamed wilderness alongside towns and cities escapes rapidly reclaimed by Nature opposing factions from the remnants of the government to lawless renegades do their best to survive but the truth is in this world there's very little worth01:38living for The Last of Us does a wonderful job of putting this hopelessness directly on your shoulders the despair is tangible from start to finish everything littering the game's varied environments is there for a reason everything tells you a story from the subtle to the overt The Last of Us does a brilliant job of setting the scene and making you feel like you're there it's essentially videogames version of Cormac McCarthy's the road and with such high praise comes high expectations which The02:04Last of Us meets time and time again like the road the last of us isn't so much about what happened to humanity as it's about the tale of two people and their journey Joel's interactions with a girl Ellie drive the story forward and Ellie quickly becomes the star they're contextual conversations which happen constantly endear you to their evolving relationship and this is kind of sad what is almost music that's just sitting here while Joel perpetually has blood on his hands a product of surviving in such02:36an upside-down world Ellie is more sympathetic it's not that she's innocent she too is killed to survive it's more that she doesn't know any better while survivors litter the game that once held a job and had a normal life in the world you and I know she was born into this desolation and our questions about what the real world was like before make for some of the game's most enjoyable discussions after all Ellie's not even quite sure what a job is and the real world to her is nothing but a03:01dream watching this dichotomy play out is one of the last of us as strokes of genius of course the game is gorgeous to boot it is perhaps PlayStation 3's prettiest game both in game and during cutscenes and the aesthetics are only heightened by a beautifully written story and expert voice acting these elements drive the story home and put it at the forefront of the experience and that's a good thing because as great as the Last of Us plays at the end of the day it's really all about the story [Music]03:30I may have so far given you the impression that other humans are the only danger in the last of us but that's far from the truth you see that fungus cordyceps doesn't actually kill people it turns them into frenzied monsters known as the infected and those foes who are contagious by the way are even bigger threats than other humans they don't practice self-preservation and they aren't subtle whether you're fighting the lesser infected called runners or they're blind hyper infected counterparts known as clickers the fear04:05is palpable especially because if the latter so much as get their teeth into you it's game over human enemies on the other hand are a bit smarter they work together and react to what you do you'll have to approach each fight differently and this gives the last of us an amazing perpetually unpredictable feel to deal with his adversaries joel has a litany of weapons and makeshift items that rest at the heart of the Last of Us is superb combat system as you might imagine ammunition is scarce very scarce in fact04:29forcing Joel and others like him to cleverly navigate precarious situations when and where possible stealth is king slinking about environments while quietly and covertly taking out enemies by strangling stabbing or otherwise brutalizing them without so much as a peep but when push comes to shove hostilities are heightened and it's not only your firearms that give you an edge indeed by finding the right supplies in the environment raging from scissors and tape to sugar and alcohol Joel could concoct a slew of curative and offensive04:56items this ability gives Joel the feeling of a guerrilla fighter someone using the environment and all it provides to its fullest advantage it forces you to make choices as items are created using ingredients needed to make other items this makes the player feel both vulnerable and mighty at the same time as Joel is always a mistake away from death but a lucky break away from living to see another day better yet the game never ever pauses when you're making these items are toggling through your menus if you need to deploy a05:21homemade grenade you'll do so in real time if you need to create a health kit you better hope there are no enemies around the last so much totes an amazing sense of urgency that can only be avoided when you're already assured that the coast is clear and in this world the coast isn't clear very often the last of us also comes packing a multiplayer mode and much like Uncharted it's an aside - it's amazing single-player campaign with that said the Last of Us is multiplayer modes supply raid and05:44survivors are a typical multiplayer options and play wonderfully into the last busses dire mood what's most unique about them is their ingenious metagame slant that ties into each and every online match you play no matter who you play with by finding items throughout the map you support a group of survivors that you're the leader of the more you find the more robust your group becomes though the survivors you support are occasionally hit by disease and other dangers that you need to figure out ways around usually by achieving certain06:09statistical milestones in multiplayer maps while multiplayer is in no way the focus of the Last of Us it's a nice supplement to the campaign and it's surprisingly thoughtful and engaging to boot The Last of Us is a masterpiece a case study and how games can immerse you tell a fascinating story and make you really care about its characters the travels of Joel and Ellie which took me nearly 18 hours to get through my first playthrough provide one of the most memorable heartfelt and outright brutal adventures gaming has ever taken me on06:49it's as undeniably brilliant as it is raw brutal violent and hopeless Naughty Dog should be applauded for leaving the PlayStation 3 with arguably its best game before its successor the PlayStation 4 arrives on the scene the Last of Us is unrivaled in so many ways and I'd recommend it to any PlayStation 3 owner it's truly a special one-of-a-kind game for more on all these PlayStation keep it tuned to IGN you

Output.Business as Usual: Using various foundations, seeking a product that provides natural-looking coverage, a radiant finish, and long-lasting wear for mature skin.
Output.New Behaviour: Purchased and wore Hourglass Ambient Soft Glow Foundation, comparing it to Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Care & Glow Foundation.
Output.Progress the Customer Wants to Make: Find a foundation that complements mature skin, offering a balance of coverage, radiance, and longevity without emphasizing fine lines or feeling heavy.
Output.Functional Motivation: Seeking a foundation with medium coverage, a radiant finish, long wear time (up to 16 hours), and a shade that matches her skin tone with neutral or slightly yellow undertones. Easy application and blending, preferably with a brush.
Output.Emotional Motivation: Desire to enhance natural beauty and achieve a youthful, radiant complexion. Reduce concerns about signs of aging, such as fine lines and uneven skin tone, and feel confident in her appearance.
Output.Social Motivation: Share her experience and recommendations with her audience, potentially influencing their purchasing decisions and establishing herself as a reliable source of beauty information.
Output.Force 1: Push: Dissatisfaction with current foundation options that may not provide the desired level of coverage, finish, or longevity, or that may emphasize signs of aging.
Output.Force 2: Pull: Hourglass Ambient Soft Glow Foundation's claims of medium coverage, radiant finish, and long wear time, along with positive reviews and the brand's reputation for high-quality products.
Output.Force 3: Anxieties: Concerns about the foundation's shade matching her skin tone, its performance on mature skin, and its potential to crease or emphasize fine lines. The higher price point compared to Lanc√¥me's option might also be a concern.
Output.Force 4: Habits: Using other foundations and makeup products, potentially with different brands, coverage levels, and finishes.
Output.Stage 3: Active Looking: Not enough information
Output.Stage 4: Deciding: Purchasing the Hourglass foundation and comparing it directly to the Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Care & Glow Foundation through a wear test.
Output.Stage 5: Onboarding: Initial application and wear test experience was positive, noting the creamy texture, easy application, and beautiful finish of the Hourglass foundation. The shade match was slightly lighter than her ideal preference, but still workable.
Output.Stage 6: Ongoing Use: The reviewer conducted a 12-hour wear test, noting that both Hourglass and Lanc√¥me foundations performed similarly in terms of wear, finish, and coverage. She observed slight wear around the nose with Hourglass and longer-lasting wear with the Lanc√¥me past the 12-hour mark but ultimately concluded that both foundations were excellent options, with the final decision depending on individual preferences for shade, price, and brand values (vegan and cruelty-free for Hourglass).

Output.Progress the Customer Wants to Make: Find a foundation that meets specific criteria for coverage, wear, finish, and shade match, suitable for mature, dry skin and hot weather conditions.
Output.Functional Motivation: Desire for a foundation with medium coverage, long wear (up to 12 hours), a natural glow or satin finish, and a shade that matches her skin tone.  SPF is a bonus, but not a requirement.
Output.Emotional Motivation: Seeking a foundation that enhances her appearance, boosts confidence, and provides a sense of satisfaction with her makeup look.
Output.Social Motivation: Sharing her experience and recommendations with her audience, potentially influencing their purchasing decisions and establishing herself as a trusted source of beauty information.
Output.Force 1: Push: Dissatisfaction with current foundation options or the challenges of finding a suitable foundation for mature skin and hot weather.
Output.Force 2: Pull: The appeal of both Lancome and Hourglass foundations due to their claims of medium coverage, long wear, and glowy or soft-focus finish.
Output.Force 3: Anxieties: Concerns about shade matching, product performance in terms of coverage, wear, and finish, potential for creasing or caking, and the possibility of the foundation not meeting her expectations.
Output.Force 4: Habits: Using other foundations and makeup products, having established preferences for certain brands or types of foundations.
Output.Stage 3: Active Looking: Not enough information
Output.Stage 4: Deciding: Lancome sent her this foundation to review as part of her job. She chose to purchase the Hourglass one to test both foundations to compare their performance and determine which one best meets her needs and preferences. This was because both foundations make similar claims, and her audience showed a similar amount of interest in both products.
Output.Stage 5: Onboarding: Initial application and wear test of both foundations were positive, with both products providing good coverage, a natural finish, and comfortable wear. She noted a slight difference in shade and finish, with Lancome offering slightly more coverage and a less glowy finish compared to Hourglass.
Output.Stage 6: Ongoing Use: Throughout the 12-hour wear test, both foundations performed well, with minimal creasing or wear-off. She observed that Lancome maintained slightly better coverage around the nose area, while both foundations exhibited similar performance in terms of shine control and overall appearance. In a later update, she noted that Lancome exhibited better pore-blurring and a smoother finish compared to Hourglass after 14 hours of wear.

Output.Customer Name: Kristina (Beauty reviewer on YouTube channel "By Kristina Studio")
Output.Business as Usual: Using various foundations, but dissatisfied with the performance of the original Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation due to its thick, heavy texture and difficulty blending.
Output.New Behaviour: Purchased and tested the newly reformulated Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation over three days.
Output.Progress the Customer Wants to Make: Find a full-coverage foundation that offers a natural matte finish, improved blendability, and better shade matching compared to the original formula, while still providing long wear and oil control.
Output.Functional Motivation: Seeking a foundation with full coverage, a matte finish, long wear, oil control, and a shade that accurately matches her neutral undertone. Additional benefits like waterproof, sweatproof, and humidity-resistant properties are desirable. The inclusion of skin-loving ingredients and a wider shade range are also appealing.
Output.Emotional Motivation: Desire to achieve a flawless, undetectable complexion and reduce concerns about skin imperfections, such as acne scarring and uneven skin tone. Aims to feel confident and satisfied with the foundation's performance and appearance on her skin.
Output.Social Motivation: Sharing her experience and review with her audience, influencing their purchasing decisions and establishing herself as a trusted source of beauty information.
Output.Force 1: Push: Dissatisfaction with the original Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation's thick, heavy texture, difficulty blending, and limited shade range, leading to a subpar experience and a desire for improvement.
Output.Force 2: Pull: The appeal of the newly reformulated Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation with its claims of a thinner, more breathable formula, improved blendability, expanded shade range, and added skin-loving ingredients.
Output.Force 3: Anxieties: Concerns about the high price point of the foundation, the possibility of the reformulation not living up to expectations, and the potential for the foundation to still appear cakey or emphasize dryness on her combination-oily skin.
Output.Force 4: Habits: Using less-than-full coverage foundation for day-to-day wear, and using full coverage foundations for special occasions.
Output.Stage 3: Active Looking: Visiting an Ulta store to swatch the foundation in person and ensure an accurate shade match before making a purchase.
Output.Stage 4: Deciding: Choosing to purchase the Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation in the shade 355N based on the improved formula claims, expanded shade range, and the desire for a full-coverage matte foundation.
Output.Stage 5: Onboarding: Initial application and wear test provided a positive experience, noting the thin, creamy texture, easy blendability, and natural-looking matte finish. The shade match was deemed suitable, and the foundation effectively covered imperfections without appearing cakey.
Output.Stage 6: Ongoing Use: The reviewer wore the foundation for three days, including during various activities and weather conditions. She observed that the foundation maintained good coverage, oil control, and a natural matte finish throughout the wear test, even after napping and sweating. While some minor wear and tear were noted, the overall performance exceeded expectations compared to the original formula. Despite the high price point, the reviewer considers the foundation a worthwhile investment for those seeking a reliable, high-performing full-coverage option.

Output.Business as Usual: Owning and enjoying Tesla Model Y and Model X, but not having a truck or engaging in off-roading activities.
Output.New Behaviour: Purchased and has been driving the Tesla Cybertruck for over a month, exploring potential new hobbies like off-roading.
Output.Progress the Customer Wants to Make: Own a unique and attention-grabbing vehicle that offers utility and the potential for new experiences, while still maintaining the benefits of Tesla's technology and driving experience.
Output.Functional Motivation: Seeking a vehicle with ample storage and towing capacity, off-road capabilities, long electric range, fast charging speeds, and advanced features like steer-by-wire and independent rear steering. The futuristic design and stainless steel construction were additional appealing factors.
Output.Emotional Motivation: Desire to own a unique and eye-catching vehicle that sparks joy and excitement. The Cybertruck's unconventional design and futuristic aesthetic contribute to a sense of individuality and differentiation.
Output.Social Motivation: Gaining attention and recognition from others due to the Cybertruck's unique appearance. The vehicle serves as a conversation starter and a way to stand out from the crowd.
Output.Force 1: Push: Lack of a truck in his current vehicle lineup, limiting his ability to engage in activities that require hauling or towing. The desire for a more unique and attention-grabbing vehicle compared to his existing Teslas.
Output.Force 2: Pull: The Cybertruck's futuristic design, stainless steel construction, promised performance capabilities, and association with Tesla's brand reputation for innovation and technology.
Output.Force 3: Anxieties: Concerns about the Cybertruck's practicality, including its mileage range and charging speed for long trips, whether the handling and ride experience would be smooth and comfortable, large size and potential difficulty parking, and the susceptibility of the stainless steel to scratches and blemishes.
Output.Force 4: Habits: Owning and driving Tesla vehicles, with established preferences for the brand's technology, user interface, and driving experience.
Output.Stage 3: Active Looking: Researching the Cybertruck's specifications, features, and reviews, as well as comparing it to other electric trucks and off-road vehicles in the market.
Output.Stage 4: Deciding: Choosing to purchase the Cybertruck despite some reservations about its practicality and potential shortcomings, driven by its unique design, potential for new experiences, and the overall appeal of owning a Tesla vehicle.
Output.Stage 5: Onboarding: The initial experience with the Cybertruck was positive, with Chris enjoying the attention and excitement it generated. He appreciated the vehicle's performance, handling, and range, but also encountered some challenges with parking and minor issues related to the interior and features.
Output.Stage 6: Ongoing Use: After a month of ownership, Chris remains enthusiastic about the Cybertruck despite acknowledging its flaws and limitations, such as getting cut by the panels' sharp edges, and how easily the stainless steel scratches. He is exploring potential new hobbies like off-roading and appreciates the vehicle's unique qualities and the joy it brings him.

01:34
That's an estimate, so we're going to test it ourselves in our exclusive, 70 mile per hour highway EV range test. It's kind of nice that the charge port is right here in the front of the vehicle.
